subject: Junit and JDK 1.4.2
msgSnippet: Hi, has anyone tried using JUnit on JDK 1.4.2? I get a strange problem that my menus and certain other components are not found by the finder anymore!!! The
messageBody:
Hi, has anyone tried using JUnit on JDK 1.4.2? I get a strange problem that
my menus and certain other components are not found by the finder anymore!!!
The same code works fine on 1.4.1_x versions...
Eagerly awaiting some response.
kr.


---------------------------------
The will to do, the soul to dare


> -----Original Message-----
> From: J. B. Rainsberger [mailto:jbrains@...]
> Sent: Thursday, October 23, 2003 9:28 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] How to extend our own testcase
>
>
> Dennis N. Stetsenko wrote:
>
> > <citation>
> > However, it looks like you want to reuse set-up procedures
> between test
> > suites. If this is true, extract these methods into a third class
> > which you can use from your two test classes' setUp() methods.
> > </citation>
> >
> > junit.extensions.TestSetup class (see javadoc in it)
>
> With respect, TestSetup has nothing to do with sharing test fixtures
> between test case classes. TestSetup is only for executing
> setUp() and
> tearDown() once per test suite, rather than once per test.
> --
> J. B. Rainsberger,
